        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="48474" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="48474" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.00</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="793">793</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="88"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Elisabethan Rose</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Floral Woody Musk fragrance for women. <b>Elisabethan Rose</b> was launched in 2018. Top notes are Hazelnut, Tangerine, Almond and Cinnamon; middle notes are May Rose, Rose Oil, Rose, Black Currant, Geranium, Red Lily and Plum; base notes are Musk, Woody Notes, Violet, Vetiver and Orris Root. </p><div v-pre class='fragrantica-blockquote'><p><strong><strong>Elisabethan Rose 2018</strong></strong> by <strong><strong>Penhaligon`s</strong></strong> is a Floral Woody Musk fragrance for women.</p>

<p>Top: hazelnut leaves, almond oil, cinnamon<br />
Heart: red lilly, Centifolia rose, rose oil, rose absolut<br />
Base: vetiver, musk, wood<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's Elisabethan Rose is available in amount of 100ml Eau de Parfum.</p></div><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: </fragram-photos-wrapper><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-y" id="pyramid"><div class="cell"><div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; text-align: center; background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="48474"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; </pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end;     <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2343061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2343061" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Meowkinz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1760303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1760303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Meowkinz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moschino/Cheap-Chic-727.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.727.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cheap & Chic"title="Cheap & Chic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2343061ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2343061" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1760303">Meowkinz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-09">11/09/24 07:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a dewy soft pink rose. It smells quite crisp, but strong floral. I also get the plum and berries quite prominently. Undertone of musk and orris is gorgeous. <br />
<br />
It's quite lovely. Imagine this would be ideal in spring.<br />
<br />
I do fear a little this may trigger a headache as it's stronger and more pungent then Coveted Duchess... I'll have to test more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2343061"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2343061#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2333719" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2333719" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melody Valentine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melody Valentine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Love-Don-t-Be-Shy-4322.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4322.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Don't Be Shy"title="Love Don't Be Shy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2333719ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2333719" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732">Melody Valentine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-31">10/31/24 12:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nice, soapy, clean, musky but very delicate rose scent with a tiny hint of geranium and orris. At a very push, and only because I'm looking for it, I can detect a bit of tangerine. I don't get any cinnamon. I don't know if it's because I've only got little 5ml dab bottles that all but Halfeti out of my box set are so weak, but they are. Maybe if I was able to spray a decent amount on myself and my clothes I'd be able to smell what other people do but I can just about pick up on a soapy rose scent when i sniff my skin up close.  No projection at all. From what I can smell though, it reminds me of Narcisso Rodriguez All Of Me. Just a much weaker version.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2333719"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2333719#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2313675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2313675" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mv88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193723"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193723.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mv88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2313675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2313675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193723">mv88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-12">10/12/24 16:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a bright, sparkling English rose, similar to some shower gel i used to get from The Body Shop.  other notes don't jump out at me. for me it's one of 2 rose types i was searching for (the other being a dark Turkish rose like Byredo Rose of No Man's Land), and exactly what I wanted.  I'm NOT into Diptyque's Eau Rose, but I do like Acqua di Parma Rosa Nobile.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2313675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2313675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2280235" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2280235" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sparkled"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1616188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1616188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sparkled" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragonard/Eau-des-Vacances-31606.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31606.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau des Vacances"title="Eau des Vacances"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2280235ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2280235" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1616188">Sparkled</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-12">09/12/24 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Divine! I was in the shop, oscillating between getting Elizabethean Rose or The Coveted Duchess Rose, and Elizabethean Rose was a clear winner to me. As a rose scented parfum, I think the Coveted Duchess Rose is softer and more understated, but the Elizabethean Rose just immediately brought me to Turkish Delight. It's so elegantly rosey and fun but still sophisticated. <br />
<br />
It smells clean, fresh, floral, slightly sweet. It's a statement fragrance, and leaves an undeniable impression.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2280235"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2280235#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2236958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2236958" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="librabeing"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376682"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="librabeing" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-EAUX-Primordiales/Iris-Palladium-90012.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90012.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Palladium"title="Iris Palladium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2236958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2236958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376682">librabeing</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-02">08/02/24 14:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This. Is. Sensational. I finally had a chance to visit the Penhaligon's shop in Paris and explore the collection to my heart's content. I didn't have any real agenda, other than to put scents to names. (I've admired the house digitally / from afar for quite some time, but just felt like getting a sample kit was too much of a crapshoot with a collection this big.) Once there, I went straight to the ones I'd heard of: Lily of the Valley, Empressa, Halfeti, Alula, Bluebell, The Favourite, Luna, and Babylon. Then there were the ones the store associate introduced me to: Solaris, The Coveted Duchess Rose, Blenheim Bouquet, Artemisia, and, ah, Elisabethan Rose. There were other highlights, of course (Solaris is divine, but smells too similar to something I already have  Unforsaken by Kerosene; Blenheim Bouquet is super refreshing, citrusy, and just a little bit more interesting than it pretends to be; Halfeti is, expectedly, very, very lovely, but I have too many ouds at this point!). Anyway, when I smelled Elisabethan Rose, my jaw genuinely dropped. I'm not particularly a rose girl or a floral girl. But I mean, if this is what rose can be, I'm down. From reading a few of the reviews here, it seems like the almond isn't coming through for a lot of people, but on my skin, this is like the light yet musky yet dainty yet delicious rosewater biscuit I never knew I needed in perfume form? Adore it. And probably never would've spritzed it had I not been directed to it by the ridiculously knowledgeable store associate. I don't need more perfume, and yet here we are.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2236958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2236958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2220249" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2220249" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kpop_stan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1543675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kpop_stan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2220249ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2220249" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543675">kpop_stan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-16">07/16/24 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Genuinely surprised to see this extensive note pyramid, because all this smells like to me is rose water! Extremely reminiscent to Diptyque Eau Rose EDT only the dial on the rose has been cranked up a little here. After 1-2 hours it did develop a nutty quality (almond, not hazelnut) but still remained very fresh/aquatic. Six hours later it's very faint on the skin now but still smells exactly the same -- fresh rose with a dash of almond. Eau Rose still reigns supreme in my heart but I'm really impressed with the longevity on Elisabethan Rose! If you like this kind of scent profile (I've tried many at this point) this is BY FAR the longest lasting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2220249"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2220249#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2211074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2211074" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Phylira"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250337"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250337.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Phylira" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Favourite-59836.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59836.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Favourite"title="The Favourite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2211074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2211074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250337">Phylira</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-07">07/07/24 11:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There came a day that is every perfume lovers dream and nightmare: the day I had to choose a wedding scent. <br />
<br />
I stumbled upon Elisabethan Rose mistakenly in the London-Heathrow Airport. We were having a destination wedding in a castle in Ireland and had the worst luck traveling. Our flights were cancelled and delayed, and we were stuck for two days trying to make it to my wedding. I was flying separately from my partner, and was alongside my grandmother, uncle, and parents. I was flooded with so many emotions and the genuine fear that I might miss my own wedding. We had given ourselves plenty of time, and still, everything that could have gone wrong did. When we finally arrived at our new connection point in London (not on the original flight plans at all), the immense relief I felt was overwhelming as we were now only an hours flight from our destination in Ireland. <br />
<br />
My mother and I had popped into a shop while waiting for our gate information, where I accidentally discovered what would be my wedding scent. Elisabethan Rose marked in that moment a new beginning for travel, starting over, and hope. This of course moved into my wedding day. I had originally packed Luna, The Favourite, and Dries Van Notens Soie Malaquais intending to choose from one of those, but Elisabethan Rose stole my heart. My mom bought it for me as a gift, making it even more special. The scent couldnt have been more perfect for our wedding. We had a handfasting ceremony in walled gardens in front of a jasmine arch full of all white florals, including a variety of roses. There was a small pond beneath where we stood, full of lily pads. It was cloudy and had been sprinkling on and off all day. This is Elisabethan Rose. It is so hauntingly beautiful. Melancholy and bittersweet, joyous, feminine, airy. Fit for any bride or princess in a castle. I am not a rose lover by any means, and I think every person can find their perfect rose with enough effort I tried for years, and now Ive finally landed on mine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2211074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2211074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2209182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2209182" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jaynemansfield"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1864613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jaynemansfield" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2209182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2209182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864613">jaynemansfield</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-05">07/05/24 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very pleasant perfume! I agree with other reviews on here, this is a very simplistic and lovely rose scent. Its a bit sweet and has a slight musk to it once its been sitting on the skin for a while. For anyone familiar with Fentimans Rose Lemonade, it sort of smells how that tastes!<br />
<br />
It has a good sillage after spraying but fades rather quickly for the price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2209182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2209182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72784">LaUna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 17:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is beautiful. Rose, roses and more rose.<br />
Rose essence, dewy, fresh after rain rose.<br />
True core represantion of "smelling the roses".<br />
It opens with zesty citrus, fresh and bright, and the Roses shine all the way thru.<br />
Soft musk drydown. Very pleasant, perfect scent for spring.<br />
Stays longer on skin than clothes. I smell it till the next day, but it's faint.<br />
Definitely wish it was made stronger.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2189468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2189468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2181763" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1042870">yerawizard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 01:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Classy soapy rose that sits close to the skin. The rose dries down to a feminine powdery (violet?) scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2169939"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2169939#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2138142" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2138142" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nm999"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1394514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nm999" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2138142ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2138142" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1394514">nm999</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-27">04/27/24 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Elizabethan Rose is a red rose with all of its thorns. I initially expected something very youthful since the brand reformulated the old Elizabethan Rose, which was a rose and geranium scent (popular with the older generation in England),but to me, this perfume is just as mature, but in a different way. Instead of being old-fashioned (like a rose-gernanium or rose-violet scent), this is like a wink to the past (if that makes sense).  If the creators of Bridgeton (a modern take on the Georgian era) made a Tudor version of their show, the lead would wear this. I reach for this perfume when I want to feel beautiful and romantic. Longevity is strong. I only spray a little because the lily note can become overwhelming.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2138142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2138142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133967" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ziva99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898768.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ziva99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768">Ziva99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The perfumer is Alienor Massenet. <br />
<br />
As many others said, I could only detect photorealistic roses. It is too simple for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2133967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2133967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105220" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105220ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105220" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-26">03/26/24 17:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought this perfume was beautiful when I first smelled it at the beginning of my perfume journey, and bought a 30 ml. But I've outgrown this perfume 1 1/2 years later where I think it's a very boring rose perfume with nothing else going on. More interesting rose scents are Carmina by Creed, Atomic Rose by Initio, and Pure Extreme by M. Micallef.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2105220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2105220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2058737" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2058737" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cookygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cookygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/Idole-Aura-67578.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67578.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Idle Aura"title="Idle Aura"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2058737ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2058737" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574">cookygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 00:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So, like the poster beneath me, this is all rose to me. I get no other notes..<br />
Thing is, although I usually love rose, I really don't like this fragrance.<br />
Yes it is very fresh and realistic but it is also very bitter to me. Not sour - I like a bit of tartness with rose to cut the sweetness - but bitter in a very unpalatable way.<br />
I'm wondering it it's the vetiver.<br />
I also cannot relate in the least to the comparison with the Coveted Duchess Rose that some posters described.<br />
To me these scents are worlds apart. Duchess is nuanced, has pronounced woodiness and just dances on my skin,<br />
This is flat, heavy and relentlessly bitter, with zero sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2058737"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2058737#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2049904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2049904" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EveRose22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1832642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EveRose22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2049904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2049904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832642">EveRose22</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-02">02/02/24 08:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unapologetically Rose. I detect nothing else, but it's a photorealistic rose scent, coming from an avid gardener. This is way too heavy to wear alone IMO but it works great as a layering scent. If my bottle were to ever run out, which it never will given my collection, I would not repurchase. The bottle is beautiful however, as are all of Penhaligon's offerings, and the name holds sentimental value for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2049904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2049904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2012893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2012893" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ysabelbates"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ysabelbates" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2012893ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2012893" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945837">ysabelbates</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-28">12/28/23 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my grandmother's favourite; like her, it is ultra-feminine and sweet.<br />
Although it isn't in your face, it does get a little sickly (not my grandmother)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2012893"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2012893#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1987618" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1987618" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Young106"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727810"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Young106" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-Arden/White-Tea-Wild-Rose-53953.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53953.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Tea Wild Rose"title="White Tea Wild Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1987618ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1987618" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727810">Young106</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-28">11/28/23 16:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No cinnamon, no almond, no hazelnut, NO ROSE.<br />
The only thing I can smell on my skin is pickle juice.<br />
Pickle juice literally stabs my nose and salivary glands for about 2-3hrs and then it's gone.<br />
This is so depressing... I was more than thrilled to try this one from the miniature set..<br />
BTW it's nothing like Liquid love and Duchess Rose from the same house. Those two are much better.<br />
+I assumed the pH of my skin might be the cause so I scrubbed my wrist with soap and tried again, but Nope</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1987618"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1987618#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1983550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1983550" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tessture"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tessture" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/I-Profumi-di-Firenze/Acqua-Mirabile-Odorosa-di-Firenze-9765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua Mirabile Odorosa di Firenze "title="Acqua Mirabile Odorosa di Firenze "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1983550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1983550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2719">tessture</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-23">11/23/23 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Goes on a green rose, true rose, very nice, and I dont know where all those notes are, but dry down it gets more powdery and blended and I like it a whole lot less. There is a sense of the super sweet rose cloy that old, dried petals have and I really dont like that. But for the balance of it's life, it's a lovely rose scent with an old fashioned touch.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1983550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1983550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1950123" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1950123" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lem0nTea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678974"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1678974.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lem0nTea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1950123ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1950123" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678974">Lem0nTea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-12">10/12/23 09:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ah, but what a pretty scent!<br />
On me it develops linearly, with a rose on the realistic side that leans sweet from what I assume might be the fruit, but never cloying. The hazelnut is not toasted, but rather raw, lending it a green undertone that blends deliciously with the nutty almond and the musk. <br />
Definitely a daytime perfume, I associate it with springtime but can be worn all year round really. <br />
Good performance and sillage, especially when compared to the rest of Penhaligon's offerings. Currently my go-to for daily use!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1950123"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1950123#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1949755" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1949755" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Treslicious"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/883686"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.883686.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Treslicious" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Rose-Essentielle-665.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.665.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Essentielle"title="Rose Essentielle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1949755ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1949755" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/883686">Treslicious</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-11">10/11/23 23:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is the fine line between rose and gourmand. You get the nutty hazelnut, the sweet creamy almonds and the jammy rose. Its sweet but doesnt scream dessert. I think this makes it good for all seasons and time of the day. I personally prefers it for daytime winter. It does not smell regal despite the name. Its a good girl scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1949755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1949755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1909480" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1909480" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1909480ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1909480" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-23">08/23/23 08:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive had this perfume in my wardrobe for about 9 months and it fully strikes me as a winter rose, sweet and pure and ringed by ice and chill. It is fully lacking in spice. I am selling a newly bought and unused 30 ml bottle as I just bought myself Liquid Love which is more interesting with some spices and kick to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1909480"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1909480#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1828787" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1828787" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LSAUG"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LSAUG" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Le-Lion-Eau-de-Parfum-61036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Lion Eau de Parfum"title="Le Lion Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1828787ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1828787" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324444">LSAUG</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-09">05/09/23 13:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Elizabethan Rose really reminds me of Rose PomPom by Goutal Paris.  The hazelnut for me isn't all that strong.  Well until you get to the dry down and that takes a while w/ this perfume.  It is a strong one which is good for the amount of money this brand costs.  But often you get what you pay for and while I don't find this a very original perfume, but the performance is excellent.    I pick up more of a black currant rose which are a dime a dozen in the perfume world.    This is nice but there are other things very like it for less money.  Lucky for me I don't get the pickle juice other smell.  A nice fruity lightly sweet rose.  Pretty linear for me, until you get to the far dry down and then I smell the hazelnut butter spread that you would put on toast etc...  For much of the duration of this perfume I get something quite similar to Goutal Paris Rose Pom Pom a nice fruity rose.  I don't think this is worth the asking price and once my decant is gone I won't repurchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1828787"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1828787#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1827550" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nocciola23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466858"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466858.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nocciola23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-55997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"title="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1827550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1827550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466858">Nocciola23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-08">05/08/23 03:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I read the reviews, I read the notes, I picked up a bottle.<br />
Am I impressed? Not really :(. I love rose and this is a very rose centred fragrance - but what I didn't expect was the pickle juice scent in the dry down.<br />
I loathe pickles and the sweet smell of them. It has no place in this perfume.<br />
I think I will persevere for awhile and see whether I can train myself not to notice the pickle element.<br />
<br />
Update: I sold this. It is just too pickle - y for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1827550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1827550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1826054" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1826054" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mad_mal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1561708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mad_mal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1826054ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1826054" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708">mad_mal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-05">05/05/23 23:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like rose fragrances but not soapy rose frags. Well, I can tolerate (sometimes love) rose frags that's a bit soapy but not overly. This one is not soapy (though maybe a little bit in the dry down), and I absolutely love the opening. It's fresh, nutty, light, airy and a bit sweet. I, too, prefer this over Duchess Rose. The weather was super-hot when I tested it, but it seems to play well on my skin. I really like it... Not to mention, the gorgeous bottle - which IMO - is the best among Penhaligon's line.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1826054"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1826054#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1802682" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1802682" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysticalArugula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysticalArugula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1802682ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1802682" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303">MysticalArugula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-07">04/07/23 00:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Best rose scent EVER I love the brightness of citrus and hazelnut opening to these sweet delicious roses. Very authentic and doesn't smell like an old person depiction of rose fragrances. What I also like is that in has a good hold of the skin that it's neither cloying or too expansive to the point where the scent dissipates. Personally, I like this rose compared to the Duchess Rose for its longevity. Sillage and projection is moderate but its longevity is worth it. She is a feminine young girl, giving me innocent Snow White vibes. <br />
<br />
Zodiac Trio<br />
Taurus Leo Libra</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1802682"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1802682#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1802594" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1802594" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lihsinhsu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lihsinhsu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1802594ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1802594" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);
