It's not too young nor too mature. To me it smells like a large bouquet of red roses with dark green leaves. More of an evening fragrance for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1802594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1802594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799450" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799450" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Katchke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1595035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Katchke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-Eau-De-Parfum-71661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"title="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799450ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799450" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595035">Katchke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Much sweeter than anticipated, sweetness sadly overpowers the rose, but definitely detectable floral notes, very airy and powdery, LOTS of sillage, roommates could smell it on me easily, mild scent headache. Not syrupy sweetness but definitely pink sugar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1799450"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1799450#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1796752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1796752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eva.daisy.88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1401688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eva.daisy.88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1796752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1796752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401688">eva.daisy.88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-30">03/30/23 20:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive never liked any rose perfume before. They all smell incredibly cheap and the rose comes across as very artificial. Thats all I can say about any other rose perfume Ive tried. Not this one though.<br />
Whatever Penhaligon has done here, its working. Its working big time on my skin. It just smells like a real rose. The very minor hazelnut note gives it such a familiarity, Im immediately transported to my grandparents house when I was younger, there is the deep red rose bush in full bloom, sitting next to the blooming flower garden, there are trees, bees, grass, soil, rabbits, the whole building in the village, it just evokes such detailed memories.<br />
When I smelled it the first time, my first thoughts were I want everyone I know to remember me that I smell like this<br />
It also lasts on my skin well beyond 10 hours, although it was just sitting very close to the skin at the end. <br />
Well done, Penhaligon, well done.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1796752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1796752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1790849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I love the creamy nutty smell that engulfs the beautiful natural roses , it's very relaxing and soothing , and gives a feeling of walking in a beautiful rose garden<br />

padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-15">03/15/23 09:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive just obtained a bottle of Delina by Parfums de Marly and it smells extremely similar to this but more sour. Its interesting how they both achieve a very sharp freshness with different notes. Penhaligons is less expensive though and this will always be my favourite because of the slightly gourmand quality of the hazelnut. This is a classic winter fragrance and staple in my wardrobe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1784076"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1784076#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1752838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1752838" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yuazora"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1607712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="yuazora" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1752838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1752838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1607712">yuazora</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-05">02/05/23 15:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got this as a present from a friend, who said that this scent reminded her of me. At first, I was skeptical because I don't really enjoy rose scents  they give me a headache with how pronounced the floral notes are. And then I tried a sample of this at a store and I was pleasantly surprised! It doesn't smell like just roses, instead, I get little notes of berries intertwined between the strong rose scent. It smells fresh but at the same time cozy, like a garden under sunlight with blooming roses and slightly sour berries. There are also hints of hazelnut and almond that stay on my skin, so I enjoy wearing the Elisabethan Rose in winter (or when I am on a date!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1752838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1752838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1726562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1726562" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kotikina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1498532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kotikina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Attar-Collection/Khaltat-Night-38133.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38133.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Khaltat Night"title="Khaltat Night"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1726562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1726562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498532">Kotikina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-06">01/06/23 02:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I also get a lot of rose oil. It is a fresh, yet 'fat' rose at the same time, with geranium adding some crispiness. I get a bit of lily too, and it is a lily nicely done, and some green notes (if there is a plum and a blackurrant here, these are not the fruits/berries per se, but a whole blackurrant bush and a plum tree). I do get the reference to English garden with roses (and not only) after the rain. I still believe that if you are looking for a photorealistic dewy rose, there is nothing better than MFK A la Rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1726562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1726562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1697587" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1697587" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1697587ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1697587" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-28">11/28/22 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The buttery, nutty notes (almond oil, hazelnut leaf) perfectly complement the lightness and freshness of the rose oil. Dainty, feminine, and reminds me of a Victorian tea party with dolls. I layered this with the Favourite until I became nose-blind to the Favourite. But I can always smell the Elisabethan Rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1697587"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1697587#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1694616" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1694616" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="River.c"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572888"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1572888.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="River.c" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Peony-Blush-Suede-18767.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18767.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Peony & Blush Suede"title="Peony & Blush Suede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1694616ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1694616" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572888">River.c</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-23">11/23/22 10:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A blind buy, but a good one. That first spray is simply seductively gentle and yet intoxicating. I was hit by a mild inviting scent of roses. After about 3-5 minutes, the fragrance starts dancing with spice, wood, and musk. About 30 minutes in, and the said combination takes over, with rose simply trailing around it. It's quite a mature scent. The gentle rose doesn't disappear, but all the other notes take a step forward. Then, after an hour, the powdery floral sweetness takes over... The down side is that there's something about the way it was concocted that gives it the familiar scent of boxed roses (or that of rose-scented paper soap) despite its wonderful qualities... Even so, this scent makes a nice swing between spicy sophistication and gentleness that just makes it difficult for me to hate it. Overall, I'd say this is a great choice for rose scent lovers who wants a fragrance that's both mild and sweet and yet undeniably mature and straight-forwardly rosey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1694616"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1694616#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684726" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1644493" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LenoreHolly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555201"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LenoreHolly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-43297.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43297.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain"title="Mon Guerlain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1644493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1644493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555201">LenoreHolly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-13">09/13/22 20:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>While I generally steer clear of rose, I bought this the day the Queen died - I had a sudden urge to smell like roses and thought this bottle would make a nice scent memory. I did not expect to love it as much as I do.<br />
<br />
The opening is fresh and crisp, the dry down is perfectly nutty and sufficiently complex without losing its rosiness. Very pretty and very daytime, without ever being cloying, powdery or soapy. Wow. <br />
<br />
I want to smell like this all summer, in a softly coloured linen dress. I want my kids to remember me smelling like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1644493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1644493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1638675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1638675" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Printeza7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36097"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36097.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Printeza7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Rose-Anonyme-16013.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16013.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Anonyme"title="Rose Anonyme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1638675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1638675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36097">Printeza7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-05">09/05/22 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've purchased a bottle as I love rose fragrance. This is nice,not overpowering and it actually smells like a rose,very realistic to real rose. I like it,on me doesn't last long unfortunately. I would not buy another bottle when finished but I enjoy wearing it,just not love it enough. 7/10 for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1638675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1638675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1622799" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1622799" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bugsy88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bugsy88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1622799ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1622799" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376517">Bugsy88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-13">08/13/22 07:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is just indescribably beautiful. It smells so authentically rose-like without smelling like plain rosewater. I think it's the nutty notes that make this smell unlike any other rose perfume. It's so refreshing on a hot day; I'm really enjoying this one during the heatwave we've got in the UK at the moment. But I think this can be worn any time really, as that slightly sweet plum note gives it a little bit more depth and stops it from being too light and watery. <br />
<br />
It does have an odd sort of sourness in the opening, which is not my favourite part, but if you wait for a few minutes that does fade and it becomes softer with just a hint of sweetness. I love this one so much that when I first got it, I wore it every single day for nearly a month, which is something I never normally do. I don't tend to wear the same perfume more than once a week, but I just couldn't get enough of this one and only had to stop because I was starting to become noseblind to it after wearing it so much.<br />
<br />
I feel like this is the only rose I will ever need, and I just pray this never gets discontinued or heavily reformulated. Sadly Penhaligon's does seem to have a tendency to discontinue some of their best scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1622799"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1622799#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1594816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1594816" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Siducyrian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1306762"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1306762.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Siducyrian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1594816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1594816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1306762">Siducyrian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-01">07/01/22 09:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is by far the most realistic rose scent I have ever smelled in a perfume. It's an airy, soft and innocent rose. I highly recommend all rose fans to give this one a try. It is a bit pricey, definitely not safe for a blind buy, but give a sample a try. I don't think you'll be disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1594816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1594816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1589746" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1589746" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shewasgarbo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496770"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1496770.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shewasgarbo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1589746ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1589746" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496770">shewasgarbo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-22">06/22/22 23:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A jammy, juicy rose! Unlike many of the rose scents that I've encounteted, this one is youthful and beautiful. It doesn't conjure up images of an Elisabethan aristocrat for me - the rose here is fresh and contemporary. The plum and blackcurrant does wonders to give an added, fruitier to what would've otherwise been a fairly mature scent. <br />
<br />
Longevity was rather disappointing, as with most British houses. I was wearing my Chanel EDT that day, and that lasted way longer than the sample I had on my arm.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1589746"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1589746#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1585939" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1585939" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missviv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1119076"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1119076.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missviv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oakcha/Diamond-15-92985.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92985.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Diamond 15"title="Diamond 15"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1585939ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1585939" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1119076">missviv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-16">06/16/22 21:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Even after the overwhelming pickle juice opening, which I would have been willing to overlook for something fabulous, the dry down was repulsive. I did try it a good handful of times just to be sure (without washing it off even though I really wanted to), but unfortunately in the end I had to give it away as, for me, Elizabethan Rose was unbearably bad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; It has a really natural authentic rose smell to it. I feel like I am sniffing an actual rose when I smell this. It's amazing! I know a lot of people associate rose scents with grandmas but I don't feel like this has an old smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1545647"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1545647#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1524374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324517">amandawilliamspalmer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-13">02/13/22 07:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favourite rose perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1503538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1503538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1493044" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1493044" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Atomikbomb_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211792"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1211792.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Atomikbomb_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Olympic-Orchids-Artisan-Perfumes/Olympic-Amber-12807.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12807.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Olympic Amber"title="Olympic Amber"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1493044ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1493044" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211792">Atomikbomb_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-28">01/28/22 14:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This rose fragrance is Sandy at the beginning of Grease, before she gets involved with Danny. <br />
<br />
It's a polite, clean, rose with white musk. I do actually get a smidgen of violet too, but a lot of these notes in the pyramid are missing to my nose. Possibly there's a bit of blackcurrant too, but it's really subtle. It just gets really white musky quickly. I don't get any nuttiness or orris/iris...at all. The wonderful thing about this, is that it does have excellent longevity, and remains pleasantly noticeable at a close range, but doesn't raise her voice. Some people are absolutely searching for things with that type of performance! <br />
<br />
If I had this sprayed on me blindly, I'd say that it smells naturalistic, minimalistic, like rose otto, and probably costs an obscene amount of money and is marketed to high class people who want subtle, "tactful" stuff. And...that's 100%, exactly, precisely what this is. It's so in line with the way things go in the fragrance world, you need to laugh a little! I quite literally had this sent to me in a sample pack from Bloomingdale's...so there's that.  <br />
<br />
I do like this, but I'm a bit more of a "dirty rose", "green rose", "rose&amp;oud" or "spiced rose" type of gal (and I'm not just saying that because I can't afford this). I prefer things a little more "post-Danny" </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1493044"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1493044#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1476682" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1476682" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1476682ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1476682" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-05">01/05/22 06:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What a beautiful and dainty rose. The fruity accord surrounds the roses in a sweet and playful aura.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1476682"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1476682#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1454521" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1454521" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mildlyfree92"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1402202"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1402202.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mildlyfree92" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fresh/Hesperides-Grapefruit-12004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hesperides Grapefruit"title="Hesperides Grapefruit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1454521ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1454521" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1402202">Mildlyfree92</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-29">11/29/21 13:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful fresh, sweet, green rose scent.<br />
I found the opening to be quite powerful, a real fruity rose, a little bit musky and a little bit powdery but not much of those notes at first. The rose note is the real stunner for me here and throughout the whole wear of the fragrance. The rose is so very green, it smells as if you are walking past some roses in a damp English Tea Garden, or you've just trimmed the stem of a rose before you place it in a vase. It's really unlike any rose scent I've ever smelled before.<br />
<br />
That being said, it's sillage really faded very quickly for me here and to me that's a bit disappointing. After 2.5 hours it had faded considerably and had become much more powdery and musky. As it develops throughout the day, the fresh green rose really clung on, with a bit of that sweet fruitiness, and that was very pleasant but could only be detected by putting my nose to my skin. I was impressed by it's longevity, after almost 12 hours wear there is still a tiny hint of it, but it is only a hint after 4 hours or so.<br />
<br />
Overall, I think this a lovely, feminine, inoffensive scent, appropriate as an everyday wear, or for any occasion where you might be unsure of wearing something too powerful, like a job interview, or as someone below suggested, afternoon tea with your Grandmother (very appropriate!). It really is pretty, and I would say because of the freshness, not your typical rose. Personally I wouldn't want to spend this much on a fragrance that fades so much so quickly, I like other people to notice my fragrance, but I can see why others might love this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1454521"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1454521#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1438985" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1438985" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="User123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="User123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1438985ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1438985" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377079">User123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-02">11/02/21 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with SummersReign8221, this perfume smells like real, actual roses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1438985"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1438985#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1431358" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1431358" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mccartneys"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243997"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1243997.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mccartneys" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Bronze-Wood-Leather-52803.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52803.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bronze Wood & Leather"title="Bronze Wood & Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1431358ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1431358" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243997">mccartneys</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-20">10/20/21 07:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me, rose scents typically come off a bit haughty; this is the opposite- there's something so comforting and innocent about this fragrance. That being said, it took me a while to come around on this scent due to it's uniqueness and an unexpected herb note. <br />
<br />
Upon initial application, it comes off very green to me- there's a tanginess that I wasn't expecting from a rose fragrance. The hazelnut stands out at first. When thinking of a hazelnut note, I typically expect gourmand, probably due to it's association with Nutella, but the hazelnut here is not sweet and roasted, but instead fresh and nutty, almost astringent. Instead of dessert, it's like grabbing a handful of raw hazelnuts for breakfast from a dish of them sitting in the sun. On my skin, a herb note is also apparent at this point. At first I disliked the parsley/celery/dill scent I was getting, but now think it contributes to making Elisabethan Rose so comforting and unpretentious to me. <br />
<br />
A bright jammy rose and rose oil are at the heart of this perfume and are apparent throughout it's wear time. The rose is not soft or powdery, but almost tart. The base notes, especially the violet and orris, add sophistication and cohesiveness to an otherwise very fresh and green scent. If you're familiar with Penhaligon, you know that many of their scents give off a fancy spa/sauna like vibe; this is very subtly apparent here as well in the dry down and works so well with the fresh tart notes that are dominant.<br />
<br />
It lasts about 6 hours on my skin and longer on clothing while projecting well. I'm typically very seasonal with my fragrances and was surprised that I enjoy wearing it as a daytime scent year-round, regardless of weather. It's a unique one and has filled a spot in my collection that I didn't know I was looking for: 4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1431358"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1431358#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422882" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1422882" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocolily1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335689"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocolily1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1422882ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1422882" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335689">cocolily1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-05">10/05/21 17:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smelt this perfume in the summer and it reminded me of something familiar. Someone here mentioned Evidence by Yves Rocher which I bought in Barcelona in 2015 - nail on the head. This scent is elegant, unique and non-offensive for work or play. I do wish it lasted a but longer, it fades off of my skin within 2 hours. Aside from that, this is a lovely scent for a feminine and floral feeling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1422882"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1422882#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1415927" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1415927" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KymIndigo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368555"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1368555.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KymIndigo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Goldfield-Banks-Australia/Pacific-Rock-Moss-44120.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44120.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Rock Moss"title="Pacific Rock Moss"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1415927ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1415927" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368555">KymIndigo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-23">09/23/21 19:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A dainty, elegant soft rose with an interesting twist. First spray is a slightly fruity rose with an almost creamy soft texture which could be the almond note. It reminds me a little of Tresor In Love at first. Next the plum note kicks in and it's more of a sweet, tart, jammy fruit-rose in the most elegant of ways. The dry down introduces a musky, woody background but the soft rose and plum jam is still at the forefront. I wasn't expecting to like this one as much as I do, the plum adds a uniqueness to the rose that I really enjoy.<br />
<br />
In true Penhaligon's style this is a stunningly well blended and quality perfume that exudes refined class. I can imagine the wealthy young ladies in regency era London wearing this while attending high society balls in search of a potential marriage partner. This would be a divine wedding scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1415927"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1415927#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1404688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1404688" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pweedyadel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1159472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1159472.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pweedyadel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/La-Belle-55786.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55786.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Belle"title="La Belle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1404688ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1404688" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1159472">pweedyadel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-05">09/05/21 01:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an elegant rose scent with a bit of woodiness in the drydown. After about 2 hours, it becomes light and airy. Typical of Penhaligons fragrances, very classy, refined and elegant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1404688"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1404688#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1398482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1398482" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Murmur123123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310171"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Murmur123123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1398482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1398482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310171">Murmur123123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-25">08/25/21 06:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The bottle may give the impression that this is a fresh and simple rose like Paul Smith Rose, but it is definitely more interesting than that. I doubt if the Top Notes and Middle Notes in the notes list are flipped? Because in the opening it is strong rose with a slight fruity tartness, and the rose becomes much more subdued after about 30 min and a creamy and nutty woodiness develops. It is not very musky to my nose, and the scent sits quite close to skin but with decent lasting power. It is not my favourite kind of rose perfumes, but if you are looking for a lady-like and elegant rose that is not too sweet and not too simple, you may want to give this a try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1398482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1398482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1395972" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1395972" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SummersReign8221"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1373237.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SummersReign8221" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rachel-Zoe/Fearless-66640.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66640.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fearless"title="Fearless"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1395972ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1395972" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373237">SummersReign8221</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-20">08/20/21 15:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Elisabethan Rose:<br />
Received this as part of a perfume sample box. I was very hesitant to try this because most rose scents never live up to smelling like natural rose. Most end up at first spray suffocating me in synthetic like rose or have no presence of rose at all. <br />
Elisabethan Rose truly smells like fresh natural roses. Initial spray the true rose hits you like you walked into a rose garden, then as the scent dries down the rose scent stays but there is a hint of sweetness and earthiness to it. The scent stayed close to the skin on me too, with moderate longevity lasting about 5hrs or so. <br />
Elisabethan Rose is so so pretty. I feel this would be a perfect fragrance for a any formal event, most suitably on a wedding day. A beautiful scent to compliment a bride in her elegant dress.<br />
10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1395972"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1395972#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1366048" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1366048" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mona708"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1262172.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mona708" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1366048ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1366048" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262172">Mona708</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-25">06/25/21 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent threw me for a loop, honestly! When I first put it on, it started out with daintily like Rose de Grasse. Oh great, I remember thinking to myself, another lightweight perfume that will just vanish after two hours  A bit later on, though, it became a little sweeter before turning a bit soapy as the rose intensified- a lot like Philosophys Pure Grace Nude Rose. Okay, this is getting interesting, I thought, Im glad I didnt second-guess it based on the beginning. Then, the jammy plum note kicked in, turning it into a fancier Rose Jam and I loved it! The plum and the rose are most noticeable on me, but the geranium and black currant temper them well. Its rich and feminine without feeling too overwhelming, even during a humid Chicago summer day. I especially like how versatile it is when layered; I like layering it most with Jvans White Musk Woman and Salvatore Ferragamo. If it were easier to find and less expensive, I would grab some in a heartbeat!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1366048"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1366048#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356043" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mb0793"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mb0793" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentina-Poudre-34936.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34936.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentina Poudre"title="Valentina Poudre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); Sadly this didn't work for me. It has an old and weird note (maybe the hazelnut leaf?) that is really prominent on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1356043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1356043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356027" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its a deliciously dewy and tangy rose.
