I was taken aback by how rich yet delicate the rose is in this fragrance. Its incredibly fresh and Id say its a great wear for either day or night in warmer weather. On reflection, it reminds me of a cheaper perfume I had in 2015 called Evidence by Yves Rocher. Very similar scents</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1338258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1338258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327703" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1327703" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ms.moniczka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328198"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1328198.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ms.moniczka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tiziana-Terenzi/Borea-55000.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55000.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Borea"title="Borea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1327703ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1327703" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328198">ms.moniczka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-18">04/18/21 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't like it. Rose is in your face and it's not nice sweet rose. This rose is fresh and sour. I also smell very strong green fresh note(it must be hazelnut leaf) and a little of wood. Definitely no fruits in here. It's sickening and doesn't change through the day. You need to have good mood for this scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1327703"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1327703#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1308000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1308000" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="witch_x3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="witch_x3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jessica-Simpson/Fancy-4094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fancy"title="Fancy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1308000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1308000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041">witch_x3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-15">03/15/21 02:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sample of this and have worn it a couple of times and while I love how unique it is - it is just not for me. I prefer a fresh cut rose or a jammy rose and the nuttiness of this just keeps throwing me off. Again, super unique and interesting but not just not for me at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1308000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1308000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1277449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1277449" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tulpan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1110821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tulpan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rihanna/Reb-l-Fleur-10554.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10554.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Reb'l Fleur"title="Reb'l Fleur"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1277449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1277449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1110821">Tulpan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-17">01/17/21 09:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh rose that's great daytime scent. I also tried Penhaligon's 'The Coveted Duchess Rose' and they are quite similar to each other. I prefer the Duchess, as it is a bit woodier and has a nice musk coming through. In comparison, Elisabethan Rose smells to me fresher making it more suitable for warmer weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1277449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1277449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1276832" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1276832" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toni.w"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toni.w" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Douze/Sans-Rival-Leo-83929.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83929.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sans Rival Leo"title="Sans Rival Leo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1276832ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1276832" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361">toni.w</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 04:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A grown-up, sophisticated and gourmand rose scent. It smells expensive, and similar to other Penhaligon's fragrances, it might render a deja vu feeling whilst remaining unique. Truly one of a kind!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1276832"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1276832#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1275576" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1275576" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavenderclouds"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1251807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavenderclouds" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1275576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1275576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251807">lavenderclouds</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-13">01/13/21 18:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not only one of the most elegant rose fragrances I've ever smelled, it's one of the most elegant fragrances I've ever smelled period. <br />
<br />
For me, what makes Elisabethan Rose so unique is that it evokes imagery of Waterford crystal vases and delicate strands of pearls and chilly English mornings in the gardens of a large estate. It's so different from your typical almond-rose, spicy rose, peony-rose, honey-rose, or gourmand rose. It's a dewy, cold, proud red rose with a green stem and a vaguely nutty, somewhat powdery undertone due to the hazelnut, violet, and orris. There's nothing sweet or youthful or warm hereonly rich, chilly opulence. Rather than airiness, there's a beautiful clarity to it, as if you're looking at a rose in a beautiful crystal stand. You could imagine a wealthy, haughty grand old dame wearing itbut it also doesn't smell grandmotherly or fussy or stale in any way. It's pure maturity, elegance, and refined class. Wearing this truly makes me feel like a duchess from another time!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1275576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1275576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1274520" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1274520" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginandrice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1246357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginandrice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aesop/Hwyl-46895.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46895.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hwyl"title="Hwyl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1274520ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1274520" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357">ginandrice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-11">01/11/21 19:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Elizabethan Rose is a plant-ish, faintly spicy rose scent that makes me think of the stamen of a rose, if you stick your nose right down into the base of a loose, open bloom. Its rose core is supported by a papery woody note, and the unmistakable rootiness of orris.<br />
<br />
Theres a fruit accord, as well, but it stays close to the rose note, filling it out without attracting attention. <br />
<br />
Its a very polite, mild fragrance. You could wear it to tea with your octogenarian grandmother, who is rather frail and sensitive to loud fragrances.  <br />
<br />
I find it pleasant, but much too subdued and unobtrusive for my personal liking.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1274520"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1274520#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1251237" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1251237" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MaquiLab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MaquiLab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1251237ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1251237" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834">MaquiLab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-21">11/21/20 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, Elizabethan Rose gets straight to the point - dewy, early morning rose. It's a rather fresh fragrance at first. Then, as time goes by, it matures beautifully powdery. I'm currently watching The Great on HBO, and this is a fragrance that suits very well rosy-cheeked young Catherine!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1251237"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1251237#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1220596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1220596" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marisa36"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/22240"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.22240.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marisa36" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-Eau-de-Toilette-50747.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50747.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain Eau de Toilette"title="Mon Guerlain Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1220596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1220596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); Can hardly smell the rose.  All I can smell is an old and I mean very old cupboard.  Oh dear. I had high hopes for this one, but unfortunately not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1220596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1220596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1161223" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1161223" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Annabear"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1039259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Annabear" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Eau-Suave-5625.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5625.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Suave"title="Eau Suave"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1161223ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1161223" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259">Annabear</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-06">04/06/20 01:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really lovely  fresh dewy rose with a slightly acidic/citrus opening to my senses. The hazelnut leaf does not assert itself but can be found in the transitional phase, and provides a creamy foundation on which the young green stemmed roses dance upon.<br />
Quite a feminine fragrance and its pretty addictive too. Reasonably good staying power which isnt always the case for some of the new Penhaligon creations.<br />
If you can get this at a good price I would recommend it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1161223"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1161223#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1150132" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1128822" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="meroo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.472277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="meroo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Tragedy-of-Lord-George-40716.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40716.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Tragedy of Lord George"title="The Tragedy of Lord George"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1128822ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1128822" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472277">meroo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-29">12/29/19 02:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I gave a tiny 10ml to my gf at the time to see how would she like it. She texted me a few days later from work "3 compliments in my first 45 minutes at the office".<br />
<br />
Beautiful, just beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1128822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1128822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1116703" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1116703" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Calvini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/518579"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.518579.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Calvini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1116703ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1116703" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/518579">Calvini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-18">11/18/19 00:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dismissed it initially, thinking it was just another light rose that's neither realistic nor distinctive, but I gave it another try and found something interesting I couldn't pinpointwho would've thought it was hazelnut (leaf?)! It does not smell like the typical rose-almond, cinnamon-rose, or rose-musk, and stays relatively fresh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1116703"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1116703#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1087894" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1087894" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Manuscoronum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179633"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1179633.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Manuscoronum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1087894ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1087894" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179633">Manuscoronum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-14">08/14/19 21:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love love love rose fragrances. As a man it's not as typical to enjoy pungent rose and floral fragrances! But Elisabethan has a delicate woody and fruity quality to it that makes it unisex.<br />
<br />
I tested this out at Penhaligon's in Edinburgh and I had to get a small bottle of it, sadly it didn't come true. <br />
<br />
The exotic notes of nuts and violet  give this a unique character in the top and mid, it really makes the rose burst and you can smell the green leaves.<br />
<br />
Sillage is VERY high, it lingers from room to room.<br />
Longevity is also a strength, on my skin it lasted about 4 hrs.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1087894"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1087894#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1053427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1053427" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perfumeaddict777"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perfumeaddict777" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/Tresor-Midnight-Rose-11721.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11721.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Trsor Midnight Rose"title="Trsor Midnight Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1053427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1053427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995130">Perfumeaddict777</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-22">04/22/19 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have both versions of this perfume. I have the Vintage and the newer one. I actually like the newer one better .I'm in love with the hazelnut and Rose combination. This opens very peppery to my nose. I get a lot of spicy carnation mixed with sweet soapy Rose and cinnamon and loads of hazelnut. The hazelnut reminds me of the hazelnut in the little individual creamers. It's sweet nutty and slightly bitter. The middle phase the hazelnut is still holding on but not as strongly and now the perfume becomes slightly sour, sweet, with Jammy plum ,Rose and musk in the background. The dry down reminds me a lot of Kenzo flower in the air but a more grown-up version. It smells like raspberries to me, mixed with Vintage Rose soap. Elisabethan Rose is very beautiful, has great sillage and great staying power. I don't get in the mood for Rose's very often when they're fresh or soapy. I normally love my roses very spicy, dark, Woody and Smokey  or smelling like lipstick but in the springtime when it's wet and warm outside this smells absolutely stunning.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1053427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1053427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1021414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its sweet and yummy, but first couple hours smells like soap on me (just like the duchess rose) and I still like it and will use this summer, and the bottle is so very cute. However, if I didnt find it at a big discount, I wouldnt buy it.  <br />
Overall, the dry down is pretty and makes up for the cheap soapy smell in the top</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="953150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=953150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939532" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/946697">Old Herbaceous</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-04">05/04/18 19:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very lovely rose scent! It is very rosy but not sweet -- the nutty, woody, and spicy notes dress it up. This is a rose for grownups who are neither "old ladies" nor girls. It opens as a spicy rose, and as it dries down it becomes more of a dryish, woody skin scent but still with rose undertones. I am really loving this! An early Mother's Day gift which I will enjoy very much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="939532"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=939532#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc939468" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perfume Beginners"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1092780.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perfume Beginners" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Ta-if-4922.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4922.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ta'if"title="Ta'if"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma939468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd939468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780">Perfume Beginners</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-04">05/04/18 15:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very elegant rose scent. It is not the stunning kind of scent or girl if it is personified. Rather I'd say it is a graceful, elegant and wise lady whom you will be attracted to time by time. She is not flamboyant and remain a simple, healthy and lady-like lifestyle instead. An original and unique one among the large sum of rose scents I have smelled before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="939468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=939468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent928907" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/177739">HUEbris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-03">04/03/18 04:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>rosy woody nutty somewhat fresh milk cream vibe. I like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="928907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=928907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent926938" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc926938" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="krassy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64042"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="krassy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Mon-Parfum-8275.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8275.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Parfum"title="Mon Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma926938ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd926938" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64042">krassy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-28">03/28/18 06:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have tried today this perfume and it was immediately love! I have bought it and now that I wear it for 4 hours already, i am glad i did. I have tried the iriginal version time ago and I didn't lime it very much. It was a classic English rose to me, too old ladylike and simple. A rose I have smelled so many times before.<br />
This one is different. It is a fresh but a bit spicy rise to my nose. In the first 10 mins the hazelnut is very distinguishable. A strange but apealing note to me. I love rose perfumes and I have planty of them, mostly niche ones, but I am very demabding ob chosung them, as I seek fir special, original rose scents. And this one is such to me. Progection and longevity are quite good after 4 hours. If you love rose fragrances, give it a try. I think it is highly worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="926938"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=926938#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1644493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1644493" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LenoreHolly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555201"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LenoreHolly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-43297.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43297.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain"title="Mon Guerlain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1644493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1644493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555201">LenoreHolly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-13">09/13/22 20:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>While I generally steer clear of rose, I bought this the day the Queen died - I had a sudden urge to smell like roses and thought this bottle would make a nice scent memory. I did not expect to love it as much as I do.<br />
<br />
The opening is fresh and crisp, the dry down is perfectly nutty and sufficiently complex without losing its rosiness. Very pretty and very daytime, without ever being cloying, powdery or soapy. Wow. <br />
<br />
I want to smell like this all summer, in a softly coloured linen dress. I want my kids to remember me smelling like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1644493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1644493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1275576" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1275576" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavenderclouds"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1251807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavenderclouds" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1275576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1275576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251807">lavenderclouds</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-13">01/13/21 18:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not only one of the most elegant rose fragrances I've ever smelled, it's one of the most elegant fragrances I've ever smelled period. <br />
<br />
For me, what makes Elisabethan Rose so unique is that it evokes imagery of Waterford crystal vases and delicate strands of pearls and chilly English mornings in the gardens of a large estate. It's so different from your typical almond-rose, spicy rose, peony-rose, honey-rose, or gourmand rose. It's a dewy, cold, proud red rose with a green stem and a vaguely nutty, somewhat powdery undertone due to the hazelnut, violet, and orris. There's nothing sweet or youthful or warm hereonly rich, chilly opulence. Rather than airiness, there's a beautiful clarity to it, as if you're looking at a rose in a beautiful crystal stand. You could imagine a wealthy, haughty grand old dame wearing itbut it also doesn't smell grandmotherly or fussy or stale in any way. It's pure maturity, elegance, and refined class. Wearing this truly makes me feel like a duchess from another time!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1275576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1275576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939532" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc939532" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Old Herbaceous"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/946697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.946697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Old Herbaceous" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Parfums-de-Rosine/Bulle-de-Rose-69793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bulle de Rose"title="Bulle de Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma939532ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd939532" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/946697">Old Herbaceous</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-04">05/04/18 19:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very lovely rose scent! It is very rosy but not sweet -- the nutty, woody, and spicy notes dress it up. This is a rose for grownups who are neither "old ladies" nor girls. It opens as a spicy rose, and as it dries down it becomes more of a dryish, woody skin scent but still with rose undertones. I am really loving this! An early Mother's Day gift which I will enjoy very much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="939532"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=939532#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1622799" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1622799" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bugsy88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bugsy88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1622799ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1622799" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376517">Bugsy88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-13">08/13/22 07:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is just indescribably beautiful. It smells so authentically rose-like without smelling like plain rosewater. I think it's the nutty notes that make this smell unlike any other rose perfume. It's so refreshing on a hot day; I'm really enjoying this one during the heatwave we've got in the UK at the moment. But I think this can be worn any time really, as that slightly sweet plum note gives it a little bit more depth and stops it from being too light and watery. <br />
<br />
It does have an odd sort of sourness in the opening, which is not my favourite part, but if you wait for a few minutes that does fade and it becomes softer with just a hint of sweetness. I love this one so much that when I first got it, I wore it every single day for nearly a month, which is something I never normally do. I don't tend to wear the same perfume more than once a week, but I just couldn't get enough of this one and only had to stop because I was starting to become noseblind to it after wearing it so much.<br />
<br />
I feel like this is the only rose I will ever need, and I just pray this never gets discontinued or heavily reformulated. Sadly Penhaligon's does seem to have a tendency to discontinue some of their best scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1622799"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1622799#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1545647" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313856">Asca Naca</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-17">04/17/22 22:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Out of all the rose fragrances I've ever smelled, this one is my favorite. It has a really natural authentic rose smell to it. I feel like I am sniffing an actual rose when I smell this. It's amazing! I know a lot of people associate rose scents with grandmas but I don't feel like this has an old smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1545647"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1545647#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="48474" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>

</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent2058737" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2058737" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cookygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cookygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/Idole-Aura-67578.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67578.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Idle Aura"title="Idle Aura"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2058737ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2058737" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574">cookygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 00:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So, like the poster beneath me, this is all rose to me. I get no other notes..<br />
Thing is, although I usually love rose, I really don't like this fragrance.<br />
Yes it is very fresh and realistic but it is also very bitter to me. Not sour - I like a bit of tartness with rose to cut the sweetness - but bitter in a very unpalatable way.<br />
I'm wondering it it's the vetiver.<br />
I also cannot relate in the least to the comparison with the Coveted Duchess Rose that some posters described.<br />
To me these scents are worlds apart. Duchess is nuanced, has pronounced woodiness and just dances on my skin,<br />
This is flat, heavy and relentlessly bitter, with zero sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2058737"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2058737#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356043" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mb0793"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mb0793" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentina-Poudre-34936.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34936.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentina Poudre"title="Valentina Poudre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1344154">mb0793</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-07">06/07/21 10:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dewy, fresh rose scent. Sadly this didn't work for me. It has an old and weird note (maybe the hazelnut leaf?) that is really prominent on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1356043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1356043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1308000" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1308000" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="witch_x3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="witch_x3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jessica-Simpson/Fancy-4094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fancy"title="Fancy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1308000ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1308000" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041">witch_x3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-15">03/15/21 02:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sample of this and have worn it a couple of times and while I love how unique it is - it is just not for me. I prefer a fresh cut rose or a jammy rose and the nuttiness of this just keeps throwing me off. Again, super unique and interesting but not just not for me at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="1308000"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=1308000#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133967" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ziva99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898768.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ziva99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898768">Ziva99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The perfumer is Alienor Massenet. <br />
<br />
As many others said, I could only detect photorealistic roses. It is too simple for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="48474"comment_id="2133967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Elisabethan-Rose-48474.html?ccid=2133967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1150132" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1150132" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1150132ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1150132" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);         <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"

        <a href="/news/Fragrance-Innovation-Summit-Focus-on-the-Perfumery-of-Today-and-Tomorrow-21562.html#cc275722"><span class="link-span"></span>
                        <span class="ztworowseclipse"> Fragrance Innovation Summit: Focus on the Perfumery of Today and Tomorrow</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="Nothing new here, just different slants on technologies that have been around for years. It is difficult to come out with new technologies for the fragrance industry. At the end of the day, we all just want to smell good without reinventing the wheel that hs been around for hundreds of years.">by

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.com.br").replace(/designers/, "desenhista") });
                if (lang == 'EL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.gr").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'ZH') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.asia").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'SR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });
                if (lang == 'RO') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
